issue.title: Use "backend style" radio toggle in front-end
issue.body:
**Original author :** Blatti Yves

We really like the "toggle radio" buttons in backend like this one :
!http://i.stack.imgur.com/I8dQv.png!

But they're not natively supported in front-end.
The need a JS script found in backend or in protostar Template for front-end (see http://asitvd.depth.ch/templates/protostar/js/template.js).

There's is already one or two of these used in easySDI FE, in pricing management.

We should either set this (presence of this script) as a prerequisite (use protostar, or add script in template) or not use them.

To enable radios like this in a form:
```

        <field name="data_free_fixed_fee" 
               type="radio" 
               class="btn-group btn-group-yesno"
               label="COM_EASYSDI_SHOP_FORM_LBL_PRICINGORGANISM_FIXED_COSTS_IF_DATA_FREE"
               description="COM_EASYSDI_SHOP_FORM_DESC_PRICINGORGANISM_FIXED_COSTS_IF_DATA_FREE"
               default="0">
            <option value="0">JNO</option>
            <option value="1">JYES</option>
        </field>
```


What does TC thinks of this ?

**Fixed versions :** 4.3.1
